channel.title: Home on Website of RRMaximiliano
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Website of RRMaximiliano

item.title: TvsC Stata command for tables
item.description: Balance tables One of most common tables you tend to make in economics is a balance table.

item.title: Research
item.description: Fields of interest: Development economics • Impact evaluations • Labor market • Violence and conflict

item.title: A completely useless command in Stata
item.description: While I was running a bit more than 5000 regressions in Stata, a friend of mine asked me what I usually do after running and exporting my regressions; well, I had the brilliant and useless idea of creating a command in Stata that mimics the face I make every time my code fails to run.

item.title: Errores en las visualizaciones del Nuevo Diario
item.description: Un punto importante en el análisis de datos es la visualización.

item.title: Presos y presas políticos en Nicaragua
item.description: Desde mi cuenta en twitter, he compartido gráficos y analizado diversos datos sobre la crisis política en Nicaragua.

item.title: Bio
item.description: I am originally from Nicaragua (born and raised) where I attended the Universidad Centroamericana (UCA) for my bachelor studies, graduating with honors in applied economics in 2015.

item.title: Data Projects
item.description: I would like to share some datasets and repositories that I have created or cleaned that might be helpful for other researchers.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Adjunct Lecturer Undergraduate Social and Human Economy, Universidad Centroamericana, Nicaragua.

item.title: Links
item.description: Here are some useful links that I believe are of tremendous help for research assistants:

item.title: Welcome
item.description: I am currently working as a research assistant at The World Bank, Development Impact Evaluation (DIME) unit where I have been evaluating a cross-randomized experiment at both the village and individual level in Rwanda.
